body_html:
Sorry for my late reply. But I still have the same issue with the commit 34880c4

I did a brand new clone of Tensorflow by running:

git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow

Then I recompiled everything

./configure
bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer
bazel-bin/tensorflow/cc/tutorials_example_trainer --use_gpu
bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg
PYTHONUSERBASE=/usr/local/python pip install --user /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-0.7.1-py2-none-any.whl
cd tensorflow/models/image/mnist
python convolutional.py

And I still have the same error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "convolutional.py", line 34, in <module>
    import tensorflow as tf
  File "/usr/local/python/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/__init__.py", line 23, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import *
  File "/usr/local/python/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 41, in <module>
    raise ImportError(msg)
ImportError: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/python/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 35, in <module>
    from tensorflow.core.framework.graph_pb2 import *
  File "/usr/local/python/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/core/framework/graph_pb2.py", line 6, in <module>
    from google.protobuf import descriptor as _descriptor
ImportError: No module named google.protobuf


Error importing tensorflow.  Unless you are using bazel,
you should not try to import tensorflow from its source directory;
please exit the tensorflow source tree, and relaunch your python interpreter
from there.

And indeed if I run the command help('modules'), I still don't see any protobuf or google module in the list.

body:
Sorry for my late reply. But I still have the same issue with the commit https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/34880c4ca1a83b443b44dc415b74deb217c42257

I did a brand new clone of Tensorflow by running:

```
git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow
```

Then I recompiled everything

```
./configure
bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer
bazel-bin/tensorflow/cc/tutorials_example_trainer --use_gpu
bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg
PYTHONUSERBASE=/usr/local/python pip install --user /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-0.7.1-py2-none-any.whl
cd tensorflow/models/image/mnist
python convolutional.py
```

And I still have the same error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "convolutional.py", line 34, in <module>
    import tensorflow as tf
  File "/usr/local/python/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/__init__.py", line 23, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import *
  File "/usr/local/python/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 41, in <module>
    raise ImportError(msg)
ImportError: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/python/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 35, in <module>
    from tensorflow.core.framework.graph_pb2 import *
  File "/usr/local/python/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/core/framework/graph_pb2.py", line 6, in <module>
    from google.protobuf import descriptor as _descriptor
ImportError: No module named google.protobuf


Error importing tensorflow.  Unless you are using bazel,
you should not try to import tensorflow from its source directory;
please exit the tensorflow source tree, and relaunch your python interpreter
from there.
```

And indeed if I run the command `help('modules')`, I still don't see any `protobuf` or `google` module in the list.
